alert.note: Alert for McKinley; Rio Arriba; San Juan; Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued May 01 at 4:17PM MDT until May 01 at 4:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Northwestern McKinley County in west central New Mexico... Northwestern Rio Arriba County in north central New Mexico... Northwestern Sandoval County in north central New Mexico... San Juan County in northwestern New Mexico... * Until 445 PM MDT. * At 416 PM MDT, an area of dust was near El Huerfano Trading Post, or 23 miles south of Bloomfield, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Less than one half mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Satellite imagery. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Highway 550 between Mile Markers 102 and 174. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 32 and 140. Highway 491 and New Mexico State route 371. Locations impacted include... Farmington, Kirtland, Bloomfield, Aztec, Dulce, Navajo Dam, Nakaibito, Nageezi, Upper Fruitland and Brimhall Nizhoni. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. Pull your vehicle fully off the side of the road, keep your headlights off, and take your foot off of the brake pedal. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!

area.areaDesc: McKinley; Rio Arriba; San Juan; Sandoval
